If you roam long enough during lane phase when you're ADC has to stay there to farm up, he will inevitably either have to fight out of his turret a little, or get dove under it.

Exactly. The ADC CAN 1v2.

The original comment by Battlecast Janna was that you couldn't be a support if you were smiting/jgling/roaming/counterjgling.

You can do that fine. You're allowed to roam. You're allowed to leave the ADC to 1v2. Bard does it, thresh does it, blitz do it. You aren't the ADCs slave. If you play as such, and aren't a cleric-type of champ, you will never climb. 

As long as you don't leave the ADC there for too long, it's fine. 
But yes, you can jgl, counterjgl, roam, and take smite as a support.

Ivern supp does it, a while ago, Blitz could do it too

The important part is timing. If you roam before level 6 and your ADC's first buy, he is probably going to die. If you don't get a kill on your roam, you are going to return to lane under leveled and ruin the lane. I'm fine with a roaming support but most people I play with don't understand the windows of opportunity very well, or the ADC's windows of vulnerability. Heck even during Worlds I watched that Likkrit guy roam and throw his lane. It's a razors edge that I wouldn't be surprised if it has under 50% success rate.
tell that to the guy that got banned for doing it

You can still roam. You can still take smite. I do that with Ivern support. Not bannable. If you flame about it, you're the problem.

> [{quoted}](name=Tyrian Purple,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xThtG9nr,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-11-19T21:16:46.085+0000)

There more to it that just ratios. (While the passive did help his support build, it kinda always been their as an off meta.) 

The other part is the fact that they are very much spell slinger. Brands passive means that his spells do more damage or have greater effect when in constant use. Similarly, CDR on Zyra insures a large up time with her plants. And that spell singer nature makes them attractive for the support role because a) Support itemization is flushed with CDR, and b) lower Cooldowns means more up time on your CC, Which helps your ability to support. 

Even if you replaced their passive damage with Ratios, it would be difficult to balance them around Mid lane exclusively, without addresssing the aspects in their kits that make them great supports.

^ been saying this for so long now. tired of getting 2v1 by zyra "support" down bot if she gets a lucky snare
I wouldn't really call it lucky if it's a skillshot.
No champion should have "support" as a class. Janna should be "enchanter", Brand should be "mage".

It's a slippery slope. Most mages have some CC on their kit, and make decent supports. I can also support with {{champion:103}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:45}} although they aren't as good and probably won't see LCS play. I can't quite wrap my head around how to make mages strong early game without making them excel at supporting. Perhaps shift more damage into their scaling from their base damage, then add ap to mage starting items?
I would not advise Xerath support.  That stun is his only hard cc, and not only is it a single-target skillshot but it also has a pretty darn short duration when the enemy is close.

Brand only has a stun that's the exact same kind of spell, a straight line skillshot, and yet people take him bot, he even has less CC than Xerath who also has a slow and Brand needs to hit one of his other abilities first to stun.
brand has a lot higher bases then xerath

Which has jack shit to do with being a support. I didn't decide to be a support main so I could play mid lane burst mage without having to farm, I decided to be a support main so I could ACTUALLY support my allies to be strong.

Higher bases is always a good thing on a support. It means you do more damage with less items which means you have a better early game which translates into a higher chance of your carry actually doing their job. Just because you play a certain way doesn't mean everyone feels the same way. On top of that brand is garbage mid lane and any buffs to his mid lane play will benefit support more so like it or not the majority of players have decided he is a better support then mid and play him as such if you don't like that become really good at brand and prove us all wrong.

It literally has nothing to do with how I play. Brand. Is. Not. A. Support! If Brand is a support then Aatrox, Cho'gath, Modrekaiser, Lucian, Pantheon, Renekton, Teemo, and Urgot are support champions. If all it takes to be a support is to have high base damage then fuck it, let me take Nami to a solo lane so people can have their kill lane fun bot lane all day if that's all they care about.

There is a difference between someone that goes bot with Brand so they can say, "Whoops, I got a double kill with my high base damage!" and someone that goes bot saying "I'm going to keep my carry safe and work with them to get a kill." Having good base damage does not make you a support, it can help you be a support but it's not what makes you a support champion and there's a difference between being the team member that forgoes farming up gold and being an actual support.

I don't give a shit about whether Brand has a 100% win rate bot lane in the "support" role, it still wouldn't make him a support, he'd still be an APC that just happens to be bot.

Well I just have to disagree with you then. brand is a support now. He isn't very good mid lane. He has a kit that benefits him for fighting more then 1 enemy. He has hard cc and he has good damage. He also does better in the support role then he does in mid lane. 

So maybe help me out here what is your definition of an "actual support"?
